channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2012 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Absent congressman being treated for 'mood disorder'
item.description: Rep. Jesse Jackson Jr., on a leave of absence since June, is "receiving intensive medical treatment for a mood disorder," according to his office.

item.title: Girlfriend: Jagger, Bowie not lovers
item.description: In an excerpt from Christopher Andersen's "Mick: The Wild Life and Mad Genius of Jagger" published by the New York Daily News, Andersen claims that Mick Jagger and David Bowie had an ongoing sexual relationship.

item.title: Muppet parodies 'Call Me Maybe'
item.description: Check out the Cookie Monster's spoof of a popular Carly Rae Jepsen song. His version is called "Share it, Maybe."

item.title: Paterno defended Penn State in letter
item.description: Former Penn State football coach Joe Paterno wrote a letter before his death saying the sex abuse scandal involving his assistant coach was "not a football scandal."

item.title: Anticipation builds for Sandusky report
item.description: The long-awaited findings of an internal review into how Penn State University handled allegations of child sex abuse by a former assistant football coach are scheduled to be released Thursday morning.

item.title: Lawsuit alleges bus driver aided hazing
item.description: The parents of Robert Champion, the Florida A&M University drum major who died after a hazing incident in November in Orlando, have filed suit against the school's board of trustees, the company that owns the bus in which the abuse occurred and the bus driver. "Now, our journey begins as to really how we can eradicate a culture that's not just a FAMU problem, not just a Florida problem; it's an American problem," lawyer Christopher Chestnut told reporters Wednesday.

item.title: House votes again to repeal Obamacare
item.description: Wednesday's vote was the latest of more than 30 House GOP efforts to undermine President Barack Obama's signature health care reform law.

item.title: Syrian diplomat urges military to revolt
item.description: A Syrian diplomat left the government and ruling party Wednesday, appealing to the military to stop killing its "fathers, sons and sisters" and instead direct its artillery fire toward the "criminals" of the Syrian regime.

item.title: Dad held in deaths of 3 daughters
item.description: A 34-year-old father was being held by authorities Wednesday in connection with the deaths of his three daughters, who were found inside his ex-wife's Wisconsin home with the gas fireplace turned on, officials said.

item.title: Heiress found dead; husband arrested
item.description: The son of one of the world's wealthiest men has been arrested after his American-born wife was found dead in London.

item.title: Mystery illness in Cambodia identified
item.description: The illness that has killed more than 60 children in Cambodia will be blamed on combination of pathogens, two doctors say.

item.title: Delta fined for flying ahead of repairs
item.description: Delta Air Lines faces almost $1 million in fines for allegedly flying two jetliners without making required repairs, including repairs to the chipped nose cone of a Boeing 737, the Federal Aviation Administration said Wednesday.

item.title: Denise Rich renounces U.S. citizenship
item.description: Wealthy socialite and Grammy-nominated songwriter Denise Rich has renounced her U.S. citizenship and resides in London, her spokeswoman said.

item.title: Lennox the dog killed, despite outcry
item.description: An international effort to save a dog on death row in Northern Ireland ended in failure, heartbreak and recrimination Wednesday when Lennox -- described by the Belfast City Council as a "dangerous, illegal pit-bull terrier type" -- was put to death.

item.title: Wife chained, tortured for a decade
item.description: A husband is accused of chaining his wife up with metal padlocks and abusing her for a decade. WSAZ reports.

item.title: Man gets sucked out of sunroof
item.description: A man in a car crash flips out of the sunroof! CNN's Wolf Blitzer and Kate Bolduan have more.

item.title: Watch Romney respond to boos
item.description: GOP presidential candidate Mitt Romney strikes a sour chord with Obamacare remarks at the NAACP convention.

item.title: 105 and facing 2-year wait for home
item.description: A 105-year-old woman has been waiting six years to get into a long-term care facility and must wait two more years.

item.title: Watch shark surprise people fishing
item.description: A woman fishing in South Carolina gets a shock when a bullshark appears from nowhere and snaps up her fish.

item.title: Hear Bieber's rant on 911 call
item.description: Justin Bieber was cited for speeding as he fled from paparazzi. So who was out of control? Bieber or the paparazzi?

item.title: Stink bugs threaten wineries
item.description: Farmers in Oregon are facing a tiny invader that could cause major problems for their crops. KGW reports.

item.title: 'Casablanca' relevant 70 years later
item.description: The backstory on "Casablanca" is a good one, offering complex lessons in patriotism even today, an author says.

item.title: Watch cat interrupt reporter's live shot
item.description: WXMI's Nicole Didonato talks to HLN about reporting live on TV as a stray cat climbed up her back.

item.title: 'Himalayan Viagra' taking its toll
item.description: Ram Bahadur Jafra and his brothers crouch on a field, picking through blades of grass. They have traveled five days by foot to a meadow deep inside Nepal's Dolpa district. They came, as tens of thousands do each year, to harvest a highly valuable commodity: the Himalayan caterpillar fungus.

item.title: What if you could make anything?
item.description: Massimo Banzi's pocket-sized open-source circuit board has become a key building block in the creation of a huge variety of innovative devices

item.title: 'Buxom Bandit' gets away with loot
item.description: A cashier was threatened by a buxom woman wielding a knife. 7 News has more.

item.title: Facebook fans 'lonely'?
item.description: A report on Facebook, Bill O'Reilly and the Fox "brand," Current TV"s new hire, a Pulitzer for a PA reporter, GMA rises

item.title: New show 'too white'?
item.description: HBO's 'Girls' is the latest TV show depicting life in New York City without one of its most crucial elements: diversity.

item.title: Zimmerman's body language
item.description: An expert in body language says George Zimmerman showed signs of anger in court in Florida.

item.title: Anderson battles on 'Jeopardy!'
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper reflects on the highs and lows of his past "Jeopardy" appearances and weighs his odds of winning.

item.title: Steinem on GOP and women
item.description: Activist and author Gloria Steinem analyzes the "war on women" and says extremists have taken over the Republican party.

item.title: Working moms of CNN
item.description: CNN goes behind the scenes with the working moms on Suzanne Malveaux's team to see how they juggle it all.

item.title: Levon Helm remembered
item.description: Anderson Cooper takes a look back at the life of The Band's Levon Helm and his many contributions to music.

item.title: Man makes dating spreadsheet
item.description: Soledad O'Brien discusses the investment banker who created an elaborate spreadsheet to keep track of his dates.

item.title: Political dog tale duel
item.description: In the RidicuList, Anderson Cooper examines which candidate's dog tale will have a greater election impact.

item.title: Vanessa Williams' perfect man
item.description: Entertainer Vanessa Williams talks to CNN's Piers Morgan about "being properly in love" and relationships.

item.title: 'Only in America': Defending Axl Rose
item.description: Piers Morgan defends Axl Rose for deciding not to attend the Rock'N'Roll Hall of Fame induction of Guns N' Roses.

item.title: Rep. won't name 'Communists'
item.description: Rep. Allen West (R-FL) responds to criticism after he claimed a number of Democratic reps in Congress are Communists.

item.title: RidicuList: Quest for 'sexy veggies'
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper riffs on a staple of Courtney Stodden's grocery list, "sexy veggies."

item.title: Kim Kardashian for mayor?
item.description: Soledad O'Brien discusses Kim Kardashian's comments about running for Mayor in Glendale, California.

item.title: New judge in Martin case
item.description: CNN's Erin Burnett speaks to a panel of analysts about the new judge in the Trayvon Martin shooting case.

item.title: Why Concordia hit the rocks
item.description: CNN Senior International Correspondent Dan Rivers investigates what caused the disaster aboard the Costa Concordia.

item.title: The Zen of the knuckleball
item.description: When baseball's All-Star Game starts this week, there may be no more unlikely player than R.A. Dickey.

item.title: The holy grail of physics
item.description: Author: Our view of reality has forever changed.

item.title: LZ: Mississippi's abortion end run
item.description: It's possible the Mississippi Legislature has unlocked a way to make abortion illegal without having to overturn Roe v. Wade, LZ Granderson writes.

item.title: Web wails as DirecTV channels go dark
item.description: A dispute between satellite provider DirecTV and Viacom led to nearly 20 million customers losing access to 26 channels Viacom owns. Stars of shows on the networks led the social-media charge complaining.

item.title: Things that go bump in the flight
item.description: Take a glass, fill it with marbles and shake. That's what it can feel like inside an airplane hit by turbulence.

item.title: Blake: Dead wife was con artist
item.description: Actor Robert Blake talks to CNN's Piers Morgan about his murdered wife Bonnie Lee Blakey and says she was a con artist.

item.title: Photos: Miners and police clash in Spain
item.description: Photos: Miners and police clash in Spain

item.title: Funeral home to sell Starbucks coffee
item.description: A funeral home in Easley, South Carolina, will feature a Starbucks location.

item.title: How not to apply for job
item.description: A woman explains how she accidentally sent an odd picture of Nicolas Cage instead of a resume to a prospective boss.

item.title: Gal markets cuddles for $60 an hour
item.description: A Penfield, New York, woman has started a cuddle for hire business. She charges $60 an hour to snuggle. WHAM has more.

item.title: Why zombies, robots, clowns freak us out
item.description: What do zombies and androids have in common? They're almost human, but not quite. That disconnect is creepy, in a way that scientists are searching to understand.

item.title: Watch clam 'lick up' salt from table
item.description: Clam in a jam so gross it's now famous. But would you eat this? CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.
